enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry will be even better!" wrote Eric Schmidt in a post on Google's official blog. Larry, in my clear opinion, is ready to lead. Page will take over April 4, with Eric Schmidt taking the title of executive chairman, in which, Eric Schmidt said, he will focus on building relationships with customers, business partners and the government.

I have been wearing Unequal chest protectors, shoulder pads, and thigh pads for much of the late and post-season- resulting in pain-free playing," stated Michael Vick . The Unequal technology is a part of my game now and I won't play without my Unequal. Unequal's protective power gives me a whole new level of confidence in my game. digs at Tom Brady , Jets coach Rex Ryan lauded Ben Roethlisberger , noting how hard it can be to tackle the 6-foot-5, 241-pound quarterback. "I would've made him a defensive end," Rex Ryan said. Ben Roethlisberger will beat you up. I've never seen a guy take the hits he can take and also make people miss the way he does and be as accurate on the run. After the Eagles' Michael Vick , Ben Roethlisberger might be the toughest quarterback to sack, said Jets defensive end Shaun Ellis. "He's very strong. He's very elusive in the pocket,

been bad-mouthing the Pentagon all over town... I don't know what the hell is in Armitage's craw but I'm tired of it." There are some puckish observations. John McCain is characterised as a man with a hair-trigger temper and a propensity to fashion and shift his opinions to appeal to the media. The haste with which Colin Powell Tommy Franks sought to retire after the Iraq invasion is noted acidly. rehab. The Late Show with David Letterman when the host asked him mid-interview if he would care to perform a song. The funnyman obliged and told the audience as he made his way to the stage: You know in my business, or in our business, there's a traditional career path: TV, movies, then Liza Minnelli , your own special, reality show host, the Palm Springs Follies, and then this show... But the challenge on this magical journey is to stay relevant and fresh. And if you really want to remain white hot in the press- there's only one place to go.
